fullDescription:
The Cup of Divine Grace and Eternal Quest The Holy Grail is perhaps the most enigmatic and sought-after relic in Western mythology and
                    Christian tradition. At its most basic level, it is believed to be the cup or chalice used by
                    Jesus Christ at the Last Supper, when he instituted the Eucharist with his disciples. According
                    to tradition, this same vessel was later used by Joseph of Arimathea to catch Christ's blood
                    as he hung on the cross.
